case_vignette: A 35-year-old woman presents to the dermatology clinic with inflammation of her fingernails that first appeared 5 months ago and recently worsened. She reports wearing acrylic nails for the last year, removing them just before the clinic visit. On examination, the patient has erythema and swelling of the lateral nail folds and hyperpigmentation of the proximal nail folds of all fingers on her right hand. Examination also reveals nail dystrophy, onycholysis, and an absence of cuticles. She has not tried any treatments for this condition.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

My fingernails are inflamed, and the skin around my nails is red and swollen; also, some parts of my nails have changed color, appearing darker, and my nails are looking really abnormal with some of them lifting off the nail bed, and my cuticles seem to have disappeared.
Thank you for sharing your symptoms. Have you noticed any other skin changes on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any other skin changes on my body.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your hands?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma to my hands.
Have you been using any new skincare products or treatments recently?
No, I haven't tried any treatments for this condition.
Have you been taking any medications recently?
No, I haven't been taking any medications for this.
Have you noticed any family history of similar skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family history regarding similar skin conditions.
Based on your symptoms, it is likely that you have developed a skin condition called "nail psoriasis." **Final Diagnosis:** Nail Psoriasis.
